descripcion_original:
Who We Are

At Frontiers we are on a mission to make all science open, enabling the research community to develop the solutions we need to live healthy lives on a healthy planet.

Powered by custom-built technology, artificial intelligence, and rigorous quality standards, our research articles have been viewed more than 2.1 billion times, reflecting the power of research that is open for all.

Join the publishing revolution.

Follow the links below to learn more about our work.

https://progressreport.frontiersin.org/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=87ejFfnQzko

What We Can Offer You

We provide a range of benefits across our locations, including but not limited to:

  • We are a remote-first organization and most of our roles are work-from-home
  • 4 additional wellbeing days in addition to existing annual leave allowance
  • Access to learning platforms and dedicated learning & development time
  • A range of wellbeing initiatives, including free online yoga classes and an employee assistance plan
  • Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer

The role:

We are seeking a Data Product Manager to join our product team and enhance our Data & AI capabilities. You'll collaborate with data engineers, scientists, and machine learning experts to create reliable data products. At Frontiers, you'll work with top industry minds to develop cutting-edge AI-powered data products that drive a global publishing platform with over a billion views and 100,000 articles. This role offers the chance to impact scientific discovery in a dynamic, mission-driven environment. You'll lead the product development lifecycle, using your analytical and data expertise to guide our team toward exceptional results. If you're ready to make a meaningful impact, we'd love for you to join us!

The role will report to: Head of Product

We are offering hybrid working model.

Responsibilities

  • Backlog and Strategic Management: Create and prioritize data product backlogs, translate product strategies into actionable tasks, and ensure alignment with business goals.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration and Facilitation: Liaise between business and development teams to align priorities, resolve roadblocks, and lead meetings to clarify objectives and track progress.
  • Execution and Product Development: Ensure timely delivery of product priorities and collaborate with data engineers to design scalable data products.
  • Data Modeling and Management: Build scalable data models, develop a unified data framework, and maintain consistent organizational data across platforms.
  • Data Catalog and Logging: Create a comprehensive data catalog for documentation and accessibility and establish processes for data lineage.
  • System Integration and Source Management: Integrate datasets with internal systems like CRM and Publishing Platform, ensuring consistent processing of acquired data sources.
  • Stakeholder and Cross-Departmental Collaboration: Work with stakeholders to develop access layers and proactively lead initiatives aligned with organizational OKRs.
  • Data Analysis and Quality Management: Conduct data analysis for insights, improve product quality, resolve data quality issues, and implement long-term solutions.
  • Presentations and Communication: Prepare and deliver presentations to convey data insights and product achievements effectively.

Essential Skills

We seek enthusiastic team players with great initiative and a get-it-done attitude. Candidates must be able to handle a fast-paced work environment while juggling several different tasks at the same time. Excellent organizational, communications, analytical and multi-tasking skills are must.

Essential skills and qualifications include:

  • Working experience as a data product manager in a similar position
  • Prior experience with cloud data platforms and data products
  • Data savviness and fluency, ability to deep dive into raw datasets to find key information that will enable you to make decisions for the product (using languages like SQL or Python)
  • Strong analytical skills and prior experience in this area
  • Experience with software development and data processing pipelines
  • Experience with Agile Methodologies
  • Solid communication skills in English, both written and verbal are an absolute must

Preferred Skills

  • Statistical analysis experience is welcome
  • Experience with defining technical specifications describing requirements for data ingestion, transformation and storage, with attention to big data topics
  • Ability to understand and challenge architectural data pipeline decisions
  • Experience working a team of cross-functional people

Apply now

Please click the 'apply' button on this page and submit your application in English.

Please inform us if you require any special accommodations to participate fully in our recruitment experience. You can contact us at careers@frontiersin.org for any additional support.

Equal opportunity statement

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

Execution and Product Development: Ensure timely delivery of product priorities and collaborate with data engineers to design scalable data products. Data Modeling and Management: Build scalable data models, develop a unified data framework, and maintain consistent organizational data across platforms. Data Catalog and Logging: Create a comprehensive data catalog for documentation and accessibility and establish processes for data lineage. System Integration and Source Management: Integrate datasets with internal systems like CRM and Publishing Platform, ensuring consistent processing of acquired data sources. Stakeholder and Cross-Departmental Collaboration: Work with stakeholders to develop access layers and proactively lead initiatives aligned with organizational OKRs. Data Analysis and Quality Management: Conduct data analysis for insights, improve product quality, resolve data quality issues, and implement long-term solutions. Presentations and Communication: Prepare and deliver presentations to convey data insights and product achievements effectively. Essential SkillsWe seek enthusiastic team players with great initiative and a get-it-done attitude. Candidates must be able to handle a fast-paced work environment while juggling several different tasks at the same time. Excellent organizational, communications, analytical and multi-tasking skills are must.Essential skills and qualifications include:Working experience as a data product manager in a similar position Prior experience with cloud data platforms and data products Data savviness and fluency, ability to deep dive into raw datasets to find key information that will enable you to make decisions for the product (using languages like SQL or Python) Strong analytical skills and prior experience in this area Experience with software development and data processing pipelines Experience with Agile Methodologies Solid communication skills in English, both written and verbal are an absolute must Preferred SkillsStatistical analysis experience is welcome Experience with defining technical specifications describing requirements for data ingestion, transformation and storage, with attention to big data topics Ability to understand and challenge architectural data pipeline decisions Experience working a team of cross-functional people Apply nowPlease click the 'apply' button on this page and submit your application in English.Please inform us if you require any special accommodations to participate fully in our recruitment experience. You can contact us at careers@frontiersin.org for any additional support.Equal opportunity statementFrontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

descripcion_original:
Desde Cobser Consulting nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un Data Engineer Datalake para mejorar los data products de siniestros desarrollados en Databricks con Scala y coordinados con Data Factory. La información necesaria ya está disponible en el datalake y deberá integrarse según los requisitos del negocio.


funciones:

Analizar la necesidad de información y mapearla a los datos de origen con la ayuda requerida.

Desarrollar código en Scala Spark para evolucionar las tablas del data product de siniestros y los procesos ETL para enriquecerlo.

Documentar e integrar los desarrollos en el manual de operación/BAU correspondiente.


Requisitos:

-Experiencia de 4 años en el rol.

- Conocimiento y experiencia en entornos datalake como elemento clave.

- Experiencia demostrable en desarrollos de ETL con Databricks/Spark, idealmente en Scala (Python valorable).

- Conocimiento y experiencia en entornos datalake, específicamente en MS Azure (ADLS, Data Factory) y Databricks.


Se ofrece:

-Trabajo en remoto

- Salario acorde experiencia entre: 40.000- 45.000 € b/a

- Proyecto estable y de larga duración

- Formación anual

descripcion_original:
¡Dale un cambio a tu vida y sigue desarrollando tu carrera profesional en MAPFRE! Formarás parte de un entorno internacional donde podrás innovar participando en proyectos globales y enfocados en las últimas tendencias. Todo esto en un entorno flexible y ágil rodeado de excelentes profesionales de todo el mundo... ¿estás list@?

¿Dónde estamos?

Majadahonda, Comunidad de Madrid.

¿Qué estamos buscando?

Dentro de la Dirección Corporativa del Dato, desde el Centro de IA, buscamos un/a Experto/a en Inteligencia Artificial, cuya misión será liderar la adopción de la IA en el Grupo mediante la integración estratégica de soluciones de IA en todas las áreas. Este rol es crucial para identificar, desarrollar y monitorizar aplicaciones de IA que mejoren nuestras operaciones y servicios, garantizando al mismo tiempo que estas soluciones sean sostenibles y responsables. Como enlace clave entre los equipos técnicos y las unidades de negocio, este puesto asegura que la IA se implemente de manera efectiva y esté alineada con los objetivos estratégicos de la compañía.

El/la Experto/a en IA también tiene la responsabilidad de documentar, estandarizar y difundir las mejores prácticas y metodologías en el desarrollo de modelos de IA, además de liderar la capacitación y el desarrollo profesional continuo en la materia. Esta figura promueve la excelencia técnica y la colaboración interdepartamental para maximizar el impacto positivo de la IA en la eficiencia operativa y la innovación en productos.

Finalmente, este rol conlleva la tarea de colaborar en la evolución tecnológica relacionada con la IA, asegurando la robustez, seguridad y adecuación de las tecnologías implementadas. La misión se completa con el asesoramiento y soporte técnico a los equipos locales para la implementación de casos de uso de IA, fomentando un ambiente de aprendizaje continuo y compartición de conocimientos a nivel global.

¿Qué podrás hacer con nosotros?


  • Coordinar la ejecución, implantación y monitorización de casos de uso de IA en todo el Grupo, actuando como enlace y referente técnico con todos los equipos involucrados.
  • Contribuir a la documentación, estandarización y difusión de las mejores prácticas y metodología en el desarrollo de modelos de IA con el objetivo de promover una IA responsable y robusta, alineada con los objetivos estratégicos de la organización.
  • Involucrarse notablemente en acciones formativas orientadas a conseguir un uso eficiente y eficaz de la IA en toda la compañía.
  • Liderar la evolución y testeo del ecosistema tecnológico relacionado con la IA, al mismo tiempo que fomenta el uso correcto de estas tecnologías.
  • Asesorar a los equipos locales en la implementación de casos de uso de IA, promoviendo la compartición de experiencias con rigurosidad técnica.


¿Qué necesitamos que sepas?


  • Formación universitaria superior, preferentemente en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingenierías o materias afines.
  • Formación adicional (máster, doctorado, certificaciones…) en IA, Big Data o Data Science.
  • Nivel de inglés C1.
  • Conocimiento experto de los servicios de IA y Data de AWS, siendo valorables otros ecosistemas Cloud.
  • Conocimiento experto en Python, Pyspark y SQL.
  • Conocimiento de herramientas de visualización: PowerBI, Tableau, Amazon Quicksight,...
  • Conocimiento avanzado bases de datos estructuradas y no estructuradas.
  • Conocimiento experto de metodologías de aplicación de la IA a casos de uso de negocio.
  • Metodologías de análisis y tratamiento de datos, así como en la presentación de resultados.
  • Conocimientos de agile


Experiencia profesional:


  • Se requiere de un perfil con unas sólidas bases técnicas y analíticas, valorable complementar conocimiento específico del sector asegurador.
  • Experiencia mínima de 5 años en el desarrollo de proyectos de IA.
  • Amplia experiencia en gestión de proyectos transversales y coordinación de equipos multidisciplinares (países/unidades, corporativos, negocio, tecnología,…).
  • Experiencia en gestión de proveedores y control de costes.
  • Experiencia en la divulgación del conocimiento a través de publicaciones o como formador.


Habilidades:


  • Imprescindible tener buenas dotes de comunicación, dado que es un perfil que va a estar continuamente en contacto con todas las áreas de la compañía.
  • Perfil muy colaborativo, con capacidad para desarrollar relaciones de trabajo cooperativas y constructivas.
  • Disponer de iniciativa, con capacidad de actuar y proponer mejoras de forma ágil y autónoma.
  • Flexibilidad y adaptabilidad a entornos de trabajo heterogéneos y dinámicos en el tiempo.
  • Orientación al orden y a la calidad.


¿Qué te ofrecemos?


  • Horario flexible, para que puedas atender a tus necesidades.
  • Un programa de retribución flexible en el que tendrás: subvención de comida, cheques guardería, seguro médico, seguro de vida, descuentos para empleados, etc. Y si vives en la ciudad de Madrid, tendrás disponible una ruta de autobuses para llegar a la oficina.
  • Acceso a un plan de pensiones atractivo.
  • Descuentos en los productos y servicios que nuestra entidad comercializa.
  • Jornada intensiva de verano.
  • Serás el protagonista de tu ruta de aprendizaje, por lo que contarás con miles de recursos para seguir impulsando tu conocimiento técnico. Además, de forma extra contarás con 1100€ anuales para que puedas ampliar aún más tu expertise.
  • Poder participar en proyectos de voluntariado.
  • ¡Un lugar increíble para trabajar! Estamos en el ranking de las 50 mejores empresas para trabajar en España según la revista Forbes.


¡Diversos somos únicos!

Todo proceso de selección que se desarrolla en MAPFRE se realiza bajo el principio de IGUALDAD DE OPORTUNIDADES y NO DISCRIMINACIÓN, siendo las APTITUDES y la VALÍA PERSONAL Y PROFESIONAL de la persona candidata, los criterios en los que se basa su elección final para el puesto de trabajo.

Creamos entornos de trabajo en los que se valora la diversidad y en los que no se producen discriminaciones por razón de sexo, raza, ideología, religión, orientación sexual, edad, nacionalidad, discapacidad o cualquier otra condición personal, física o social.

Puedes consultar nuestra política de Diversidad e Igualdad de Oportunidades: politica-de-diversidad-e-igualdad-de-oportunidades.pdf (mapfre.com)

Al inscribirte en esta oferta quedas informado y consientes el tratamiento por parte de MAPFRE, de los datos personales que has facilitado voluntariamente a través de esta plataforma. Si facilitas datos de terceras personas físicas distintas de ti, garantizas haber recabado y contar con el consentimiento previo de los mismos para la comunicación de sus datos y haberles informado.

MAPFRE como responsable, tratará tus datos, con la única finalidad de tramitar su participación en procesos de selección, para lo cual se podrán elaborar perfiles y del tratamiento de sus datos se podrá derivar la existencia de decisiones automatizadas. Con la finalidad de gestionar tu participación en diversos procesos de selección en empresas del Grupo MAPFRE, filiales y participadas, y Fundación MAPFRE, tus datos podrán comunicarse a dichas entidades, y ser objeto de transferencia internacional.

Puedes consultar información adicional de protección de datos en MAPFRE en https://www.mapfre.com/corporativo-es/clausulas/RRHHseleccion.pdf donde te indicamos donde ejercer los derechos de acceso, rectificación, supresión, limitación, oposición y portabilidad de tus datos personales.

descripcion_original:
Who we are

Neptune North is a newly created Joint Venture between Oliver Wyman, a global leader in management consulting and part of the NYSE listed Marsh McLennan, and Rokos Capital Management (RC), a global alternative investment fund manager.

We pride ourselves on employing and developing only the very best talent in the Greater Madrid area, ensuring unparalleled quality and expertise in every project we undertake so that we can surpass our clients’ expectations, solve challenging problems, and deliver innovative solutions.

If you’re a great AI Engineer and a great communicator who loves working on demanding initiatives and solving challenging problems that need to be delivered at pace, then Neptune North could be the right place for you – we are building a team of exceptional people and an incredibly intellectually stimulating environment from which to work.


Responsibilities

·        Ownership of technical products and projects with AI at their core – our engineers actively engage with a wide range of business functions to leverage their deep machine learning knowledge and exposure

·        Design and delivery of systems and machine learning models that solve commercially impactful real-world problems

·        Framing business problems and commercial opportunities into AI problems – judgement and acumen to understand the true business need beyond the stated requirements

·        Challenging current systems and processes to achieve common goals through technical excellence and innovation

·        Keeping abreast of progress in AI and technology trends that will keep us at the forefront of what is possible

·        Having impact from day one – we empower and trust our AI engineers to leverage their skillsets


What makes a great candidate

·        Deep understanding of theoretical machine learning fundamentals as well as practical knowledge of how to build real world ML systems

·        Direct experience leveraging LLMs in production, and an in depth understanding of prompt design, agentic workflows, eval harnesses, retrieval pipelines, etc.

·        Exposure to LLM inference stack fundamentals such as KV Caching, Speculative Decoding, Parallel Decoding, and test-time compute ideas.

·        Excellent programming, technology, and system design skills, including an in-depth understanding of and recent programming experience with Python and ideally one of C++, Java, or .Net

·        Experience working with SQL databases

·        Azure or AWS experience

·        A strong enthusiasm for programming and technology and an appetite to work in a dynamic and integrated team

·        An entrepreneurial nature, willing to take ownership and run towards problems and someone who thrives on innovation

·        The ability to own all aspects of an AI project from start to finish

·        A desire to understand and solve business problems, build domain knowledge and increase market understanding

·        The ability to communicate clearly and professionally with our clients as well as team members

·        Financial Services experience a bonus, but is not essential

·        Bachillerato grades of 9.0 and above, and at least a 7.0 in a bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, a hard science, or a related field from a top university


Our Culture

An exciting aspect of joining a newly created business at this stage is the opportunity to be in from the start and help define the culture. Part of this role will be to help build the culture and environment in Madrid as we expand our footprint.

There are things that we won’t compromise on though:

·        We are looking for exceptional talent with excellent communication skills

·        Collaboration is key, both internally and with our clients. We believe we do our best work when we are together and working hand in hand with business users

·        Curiosity is something that we embrace and value highly

·        We want people who are positive and passionate, have proven problem solving capabilities, can work quickly to find solutions to complex challenges and unlock big opportunities

·        People need to be able to take ownership and be trusted to deliver, going the extra mile when needed

·        We want people who are highly motivated and have a high desire to learn

titulo_oferta: Revenue Generation BI Data Analyst Trainee
descripcion_original:
Are you passionate by SQL, Data Models and Segmentation Techniques? Trilled by never having a dull moment? Come and join the Pulse team!

Pulse by RHG is a home-made Radisson Hotel Group solution, like a start-up within the Company, to reshape the future of Business Intelligence, with a two-fold mission: on one hand, cross-referencing all Commercial data-point in one solution to take faster business decisions and maximize revenues and profitability; on the other, replace existing third-parties application using RHG data to optimize costs and provide better functionalities.

We are looking for a trainee who will be assisting in the development and implementation of the Revenue Management BI Platform and in providing the right information at the right time to the right people so that they can make the right decisions to drive revenue! Or more simply evolve from looking at data to information that makes you think and motivates you to do something. The Revenue Management BI Platform is developed within the parameters of the Radisson Hotel Group RevGen BI strategy. As data analyst trainee you will assist the Pulse team in delivering quality data to feed the online reporting system. This includes analyzing source data, defining the needs, modelling the data, and writing efficient queries to feed dashboards. Moreover, you’ll take an action role in the data validation process of the existing data sets and reports.

We want your internship in the team to be as excited as you want it to be, so let’s discover together in the first weeks what you would like to achieve in your internship. Some ideas we already have in mind on what you can support us:


  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.


You will benefit from training in database systems and acquire great knowledge in Microsoft Azure and/or Clickhouse. You will be coached by the Pulse Team to develop at your best.

WE WOULD NEED YOU TO BE:


  • Enrolled in a school program such as Computer Science/Engineering, Statistics, or other relevant studies, so to be eligible for the internship (internship agreement from the school is required).
  • Eligible to conduct a traineeship in Spain (visa/permit is already obtained).
  • Fluent in English


Proficient in database systems such as SQL and be able to write efficient code. You have a technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques. You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

Passionate about all you do. Nothing else than being your truly self and supermotivated to start an existing journey for at least six months.

Looking forward hearing from you!

Radisson Hotel Group is one of the most dynamic hotel companies operating in over 80 countries with strong brands such as Radisson Blu and Park Inn by Radisson. Want to know more? Click on the following link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mwdYavU6iFE.

Skills

Fluent in English
descripcion: Are you passionate by SQL, Data Models and Segmentation Techniques? Trilled by never having a dull moment? Come and join the Pulse team!Pulse by RHG is a home-made Radisson Hotel Group solution, like a start-up within the Company, to reshape the future of Business Intelligence, with a two-fold mission: on one hand, cross-referencing all Commercial data-point in one solution to take faster business decisions and maximize revenues and profitability; on the other, replace existing third-parties application using RHG data to optimize costs and provide better functionalities.We are looking for a trainee who will be assisting in the development and implementation of the Revenue Management BI Platform and in providing the right information at the right time to the right people so that they can make the right decisions to drive revenue! Or more simply evolve from looking at data to information that makes you think and motivates you to do something. The Revenue Management BI Platform is developed within the parameters of the Radisson Hotel Group RevGen BI strategy. As data analyst trainee you will assist the Pulse team in delivering quality data to feed the online reporting system. This includes analyzing source data, defining the needs, modelling the data, and writing efficient queries to feed dashboards. Moreover, you’ll take an action role in the data validation process of the existing data sets and reports.We want your internship in the team to be as excited as you want it to be, so let’s discover together in the first weeks what you would like to achieve in your internship. Some ideas we already have in mind on what you can support us:Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.You will benefit from training in database systems and acquire great knowledge in Microsoft Azure and/or Clickhouse. descripcion_original:
Job Title

BI Specialist

Summary

We are looking for a skilled and detail-oriented BI Analyst to join our dedicated and professional team. As a BI Analyst, you will play an essential role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive our business decisions. You will work with various data sources, employ SQL, Power BI, and Qlik to perform data analysis, and leverage Business Intelligence tools to create insightful reports and visualizations.

If you are a data-driven individual with a strong analytical mind and a desire to make an impact, we want to hear from you.

In This Role You Will

  • Gather raw data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets, and external systems.
  • Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and reliability.
  • Utilize Business Intelligence tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, and Qlik, to create meaningful reports and dashboards.
  • Proficient in writing SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data from databases.
  • Utilize SQL to perform in-depth structured and unstructured data analysis, identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, and generate actionable insights.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide data-driven recommendations to support their goals.
  • Conduct ad hoc analysis as requested by the business to address specific questions or concerns.
  • Implement data quality checks and processes to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency.
  • Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and BI tools.

About The Ideal Candidate

  • University degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience.
  • Professional experience as an analyst in a data and analytics domain with excellent SQL and data modeling skills for complex querying, advanced analysis, performance optimization, and working with data at scale.
  • Proficient in English as the team is fully international.
  • Experience in the SDLC software development lifecycle (including product design, coding, testing, version and configuration management, security, and Quality Assurance) relevant to the functional area.
  • Experience delivering end-to-end analytics projects, transforming vague requirements into impactful stories accessible to diverse audiences, leading to clear business outcomes.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
  • Ability to work with large and complex datasets
  • Excellent communication skills to effectively convey complex data findings.
  • Experience with Statistical analysis and data modeling is a plus.
  • Knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python, R) is a bonus.
  • Collaborative individual with a mindset suited for a multi-cultural, international organization and time management skills.

What We Can Offer You

  • 💰 A complete rewards offer - Amadeus provides attractive remuneration packages, covering all essential components of a competitive reward offer, including bonus, equity, pension plan, travel, life and healthcare insurance, as well as lunch and transport allowance and other benefits.
  • 🌎 A truly global DNA - Everything at Amadeus is global, from our people to our business, which translates into our footprint, processes, and culture.
  • 🎓 Great opportunities to learn - Learning happens all the time and in many ways at Amadeus, through on-the-job training, formal learning activities, and day-to-day interactions with colleagues.
  • 🤗 A caring environment - Amadeus fosters a caring environment, nurturing both a fulfilling career and personal and family life. We care about our employees and strive to provide a supportive work environment.
  • 🌟 A flexible working model - We want our employees to do their best work, wherever and however it works best for them.
  • 🌈 A diverse and inclusive community - We are committed to leveraging our uniquely diverse population to drive innovation, creativity, and collaboration across our organization.
  • 📈 A Reliable Company - Trust and reliability are fundamental values that drive our actions and shape long-lasting relationships with our customers, partners, and employees.
  • 🎯 A critical mission and purpose - At Amadeus, you will be powering the future of travel and pursuing a critical mission and extraordinary purpose.

Join us and take your career to the next level while making a significant impact on product development and user experience!

Diversity & Inclusion

Amadeus aspires to be a leader in Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in the tech industry, enabling every employee to reach their full potential by fostering a culture of belonging and fair treatment, attracting the best talent from all backgrounds, and as a role model for an inclusive employee experience. 

Amadeus is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, beliefs, disability or any other characteristics protected by law.

descripcion_original:
We are looking for an intern to join our dynamic and stimulating Non-Finance Audit department at Signify. Our team is based globally, and you will be based in Madrid. The Non-Finance Audit department is executing audits around the world which is facilitated by a team of 10 colleagues.

Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.

As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

We define the meaning of light…join us to #findyourmeaning @ Signify!

In this internship you will part of the operational team, here you will be a critical enabler to drive operational excellence, coordinate the team in quality standards and participate in on-going improvement projects. We seek to be greater together through peer learning in our globally diverse team, with different backgrounds and nationalities.

Are you the enthusiastic, talented intern we’re looking for?

What You’ll Do

  • Facilitating meetings and dialogues with stakeholders to gather information and insights on business processes and operations for Continuous Improvement projects.
  • Conducting research and documentation to support the allocated project, such as process reviews, including reviewing policies, procedures, and other relevant documents.
  • Learning technical skills related to data analysis and dashboard building to support the automation of audit processes (such as SharePoint, PowerApps, Excel).
  • Collaborating with other team members to identify and address potential risks and areas for improvement in business processes and controls.
  • Be a part of, or lead an initiative that creates value to the departments digitization and improvement objectives.
  • Participate in day to day business activities.

Your Qualifications

  • Working towards a Bachelor/Master’s degree in a relevant area such as Operations, Business Administration, or Data Science.
  • Available for a 1 year, and to start your Internship as soon as possible.
  • Excellent communication skills in English at a professional level (verbal and written).
  • Proactive, high level or integrity, and ability to effectively prioritize and organize workload.
  • Excellent knowledge of MS Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook and Word).
  • Demonstrate being a team player who is self-confident, accurate and resilient – displaying high standards of integrity.

What You’ll Get In Return

We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

titulo_oferta: Financial Business Partner – Finanzas y Logística
descripcion_original:
Job Description:

Únete a Nuestro Propósito - Alimentar el Futuro

Nutreco es miembro de la familia SHV, y estamos comprometidos con 'Alimentar el Futuro' a través de prácticas sostenibles e innovadoras. Nutreco tiene dos líneas de negocio: Skretting es un proveedor líder mundial de soluciones innovadoras de alimentación acuícola, que revoluciona la acuicultura para un futuro sostenible. Trouw Nutrition se especializa en nutrición animal y está comprometida con el avance de la salud y la productividad del ganado a través de soluciones vanguardistas.

Buscamos un/a Especialista en PowerBI con experiencia trabajando en las áreas de finanzas y logística que sea responsable de la recopilación y análisis de datos y de la generación de informes y dashboards para diferentes departamentos dentro de nuestra unidad de negocio.

Acerca del puesto: Especialista en Business Intelligence

Responsabilidades:

  • Creación de informes y paneles interactivos: Diseñar y desarrollar informes y paneles de control interactivos utilizando herramientas como Power BI. Estos informes deben presentar la información de manera clara y visualmente atractiva, lo que permitirá a los usuarios explorar los datos y obtener una comprensión más profunda del rendimiento empresarial.
  • Colaboración con equipos interdisciplinarios: Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con otros departamentos, como operaciones o finanzas, para comprender sus necesidades analíticas y proporcionarles información relevante y oportuna.
  • Recopilación y limpieza de datos: Extraer y preparar los datos necesarios de diversas fuentes, como bases de datos, hojas de cálculo, sistemas ERP u otras fuentes relevantes. También se encargará de limpiar y validar los datos para garantizar su calidad y consistencia.
  • Análisis de datos: Utilizar técnicas de análisis de datos y herramientas como SQL para explorar y analizar los conjuntos de datos, identificar patrones, tendencias y correlaciones, y obtener información relevante que pueda impulsar la toma de decisiones estratégicas

Aptitudes y experiencia

Cualificaciones:

  • 3-5 años de experiencia en puesto similar
  • Experiencia en herramientas de visualización de datos (PowerBI) y Excel
  • Conocimientos en SQL o DAX
  • Conocimientos financieros y logísticos
  • Buenas habilidades comunicativas y analíticas
  • Fluidez en español e inglés

Por qué te gustará trabajar con nosotros

Beneficios globales:

  • Un puesto a tiempo completo en un entorno internacional y dinámico
  • Paquete retributivo competitivo, seguro médico privado y 26 días de vacaciones
  • Oportunidades de crecimiento profesional dentro de Nutreco y del grupo SHV en general
  • Un entorno de trabajo flexible con la opción de trabajar desde casa 2 días a la semana

Beneficios locales:

  • Comidas subvencionadas en el comedor de nuestra oficina
  • Horario de trabajo reducido los viernes y durante el verano
  • Eventos regulares de empresa y de equipo

Próximos pasos

Valoramos la experiencia de las personas candidatas y nos gustaría responder en un plazo de 7 días laborables. El proceso de contratación suele durar entre 2 y 3 semanas. Agradecemos tu interés en unirte a nuestra misión de innovar y dar forma de manera sostenible al futuro de la producción de alimentos.

Our organisation:

Trouw Nutrition is the global leader in innovative feed specialties, premixes and nutritional services for the animal nutrition industry. Trouw Nutrition provides species-specific nutritional solutions consisting of feed concepts, products and nutritional know-how. The unique combination of products, models and services Trouw Nutrition offers, boosts productivity and supports animal health through all life stages, contributing to our customers' peace of mind. Trouw Nutrition's nutrition solutions have met the need of farmers and home-mixers, feed producers, integrators and distributors. Trouw Nutrition has locations in 25 countries and around 5000 employees. Our mission is Feeding the Future.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

Trouw Nutrition is an equal opportunity employer; applicants are considered for all roles without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital, parental, military status or any other status protected by applicable local law. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation. Trouw Nutrition is committed to compliance with all applicable legislation, including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities.

descripcion_original:
Workload: 100%

Are you passionate about data and technology? Do you enjoy empowering businesses to succeed through robust, scalable solutions? Join our dynamic team as a Developer/Data Engineer, supporting modern data science and automation tools like Dataiku and Abbyy.

In this role, you will coach stakeholders, enhance platform capabilities and ensure operational excellence for both Dataiku and Abbyy, enabling business teams across Axpo’s different locations internationally to successfully design and deliver on their data and analytical needs.

This position offers the opportunity to combine your technical expertise and problem-solving skills to make a significant impact on how our organization leverages data and automation tools, driving innovation and efficiency at every step.

If you’re ready to be at the forefront helping teams turn challenges into solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

What you will do:

  • Empower users: Guide business stakeholders in leveraging Dataiku and Abbyy to deliver scalable and impactful data projects, offering support for use case implementation.
  • Ensure platform excellence: Help maintain the platforms, manage cloud infrastructure and automate operational tasks for optimal performance.
  • Enhance platform capabilities: Develop core features for Dataiku (e.g., data connectors, plugins, APIs, and pipeline automation).
  • Expand in-house solutions: Maintain and enhance a custom-built management application that complements the Dataiku platform suite.
  • Collaborate across teams: Partner with cross-functional teams and domain experts to embed Dataiku and Abbyy into a comprehensive solution ecosystem.


What you bring & who you are:

  • You are a skilled developer or data engineer (5+ years’ experience) with extensive practical knowledge in Python. Experience in other widely adopted programming languages as well as experience with Web App development frameworks, distributed computation or Large Language Models is a plus.
  • Solid practical experience with Linux, DevOps, Cloud development and the use of Kubernetes.
  • You’re curious and self-motivated, not afraid to take the initiative and challenge the status quo. You have a proven track-record of fostering innovation.
  • You combine strong communication skills with a user-first mindset and are willing to learn and explore how to best address business needs.
  • Preferred: Hands on experience with modern data science- (e.g. Dataiku, Alteryx, Rapidminer, Databricks, Snowflake, ...) and OCR solutions.
  • Preferred: prior experience in the energy or trading industry.


Our Benefits

  • Lunch vouchers
  • Health insurance
  • Yearly Performance Bonus
  • LinkedIn Learning / Plural Sight
  • 90% discount on the nearby gym
  • Hybrid work up to 60%
  • Flexible Schedule
  • 23 days of holidays
  • Language lessons
  • Periodical travels to Switzerland


About the team:

Join a dynamic and collaborative team dedicated to advancing Business Intelligence solutions. At Axpo Iberia, you’ll work with innovative tools and technologies in a supportive environment that values operational efficiency and teamwork.

You have a proven track-record of fostering innovation.You combine strong communication skills with a user-first mindset and are willing to learn and explore how to best address business needs.Preferred: Hands on experience with modern data science- (e.g. Dataiku, Alteryx, Rapidminer, Databricks, Snowflake, ...) and OCR solutions.Preferred: prior experience in the energy or trading industry.Our BenefitsLunch vouchersHealth insuranceYearly Performance BonusLinkedIn Learning / Plural Sight90% discount on the nearby gymHybrid work up to 60%Flexible Schedule23 days of holidaysLanguage lessonsPeriodical travels to SwitzerlandAbout the team:Join a dynamic and collaborative team dedicated to advancing Business Intelligence solutions. At Axpo Iberia, you’ll work with innovative tools and technologies in a supportive environment that values operational efficiency and teamwork.

descripcion_original:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

The credit department at Revolut is anything but ordinary. They design, develop, and launch credit products across the globe. The team manages our products from day one to the end — developing the back and front-end, the data science infrastructure, and then creating a local setup in each country with scalable risk management and portfolio management solutions. It's a big old job, but our people are a credit to us all ✨

We're looking for a Global Credit Card Product Manager who'll be the go-to person on all things credit. You'll drive product development, improve funnel conversion, lower cost of acquisition, and maintain the best quality on all aspects of the product and customer journey.

You’ll ensure we deliver the highest quality product features, support, and service levels. We need a Leader with capital ‘L’ to own product building and retail credit products, as well as lead as an awesome boss to collaborate occasionally with technical Product Owners and the Engineering team.

We're not asking much, right? Let's get in touch.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Setting the vision for credit card products, understanding how it connects to Revolut’s goals
  • Building credit card products with world-class customer experience, understanding the full credit lifecycle of a customer
  • Defining, prioritising, and communicating short, mid, and long-term project goals of the product and market
  • Ensuring high engagement in the UX domain to deliver great customer experiences
  • Creating a high-conversion funnel and offering acceptance rate
  • Lowering the cost of customer acquisition
  • Ensuring high customer satisfaction related to understanding and experience within the credit cards products segment
  • Establishing reliable and reputable third-party partnerships
  • Ensuring zero tolerance of any compliance issue or breach of regulatory requirements

What You'll Need

  • Hands-on experience building credit card products and/or features
  • Expertise in new product design and user research experience
  • A passionate approach to customer experience
  • Broad knowledge of risk management principles
  • A detail-oriented, structured mindset
  • Impressive interpersonal and negotiation skills
  • The ability to prioritise features based on customer needs/wants
  • A deeply analytical approach and track record for making data-driven decisions
  • The ability to lead a team and build partnerships with other functions
  • Fluency in English
  • Effective communication skills with all stakeholders
  • A passion for building new processes and challenging the status quo

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.
